blocks.name: 1arith
blocks.content: Fundamental theorem of arithmetic, where a prime factorization is represented as a sequence of prime exponents, for which only finitely many primes have nonzero exponent. The function ` M ` maps the set of positive integers one-to-one onto the set of prime factorizations ` R ` . (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Nov-2012.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2014.)

blocks.name: 1arith2
blocks.content: Fundamental theorem of arithmetic, where a prime factorization is represented as a finite monotonic 1-based sequence of primes. Every positive integer has a unique prime factorization. Theorem 1.10 in [ApostolNT] p. 17. This is Metamath 100 proof #80. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Nov-2012.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm 1arith2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wral(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))
  -| wceq(c1, cmpt(s2, cn, cmpt(s3, cprime, co(cv(s3), cpc, cv(s2)))))
  -| wceq(c0, crab(s4, co(cn0, cmap, cprime), wcel(cima(ccnv(cv(s4)), cn), cfn)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s4, c1)
} = {
  a1ii(wral(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), diffss(s0, s2))
  a1ii(wral(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), diffss(s0, s3))
  a1ii(wral(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), diffss(s0, s4))
  a1ii(wral(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), diffss(s1, s2))
  a1ii(wral(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), diffss(s1, s3))
  a1ii(wral(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), diffss(s1, s4))
  rgen(s0, cn, wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1))))
  mpbird(wcel(cv(s0), cn), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cv(s1))), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cfv(ccnv(c1), cv(s1)), cv(s0))))
